nl.tno.stormcv.operation

Class FeatureCombinerOp

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tno.stormcv.operation.FeatureCombinerOp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IBatchOperation<Frame>, IOperation<Frame>

    public class FeatureCombinerOp
extends Object
implements IBatchOperation<Frame>
    A batch operation that wraps multiple Feature objects from multiple bolts in a single Frame without an image. This operation is typically used in combination with the SequenceNrBatcher which will batch received Features on their sequence number. If the FeatureCombinerOp for example as to combine three features (faces, SIFT, SURF) coming from three different bolts the Batcher will be instantiated as new SequenceNrBatcher(3) This operation will try to merge features if they have the same name simply by combining their sparse Descriptor's. In other words; if two SIFT Feature's are received for the exact same frame (same streamId and sequenceNr) their descriptors will simply be combined but no check is made if they are the same or not.
    Author:
    Corne Versloot
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
